column1: Crickets are omnivores and scavengers. They feed on leaves
column4: and seeds. Some species are predatory
column6: snails or even small vertebrates such as snakes and lizards.Field crickets eat a variety of fruits
column8: and ornamental plants. They eat live or dead insects
column11: moths and butterflies. Sometimes they steal prey from spider webs.Spotted camel crickets come out on warm humid nights to feed. They eat fungi
column15: including other crickets. Bush crickets eat leaves
column17: and fruits of living plants. Ant-loving crickets eat ants’ young.Tree crickets feed on aphids. Snowy tree crickets eat small insects. They also feed on fruit crops such as apples and peaches.If keeping a cricket as a pet
column18: they will eat fish food. Crickets will also eat potatoes.
